title: Fan, 18th century
medium:
Medium: mother-of-pearl, skin, gold and silver foil
Technique: sticks and guards pierced, carved and gilt; leaf painted
dimensions:
Height: 27 cm (10 5/8 in.)
Width: 50 cm (19 11/16 in.) open
description: Folding fan with carved and gilt mother of pearl sticks. The obverse shows a birth scene with multiple female figures in a woodland setting, painted in watercolors. On the reverse, a central cartouche portrays Venus and Cupid in a landscape setting.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fan, 18th century.
18th century. Medium: mother-of-pearl, skin, gold and silver foil
Technique: sticks and guards pierced, carved and gilt; leaf painted. Gift of Anonymous Donor. 1952-161-205.
